content: How can I alter the output color of the 'echo' command in Linux to print the text in red?

To change the output color of the `echo` command in Linux, you can use ANSI escape codes. To print text in red, you'll use the escape code `\033[31m` before your text and then reset the color back to default using `\033[0m` after your text. Here's an example:

```bash
echo -e "\033[31mThis text will be red\033[0m"
```

Here's a breakdown of the command:

- `-e`: Enables interpretation of backslash escapes.
- `\033[31m`: Sets the text color to red.
- `\033[0m`: Resets the text color to the default.

By using these codes, you can print colored text in the terminal.
